results.title: Animal school: care of your pets
results.creator_credit: Charles Cahill and Associates, Charles Cahill and Ralph Helfer
results.brief_description: An animal trainer who teaches a tiger to do tricks for films, explains to his son the need for the same care and training with the boy’s dog. Animal trainers use love and affection in their work with animals, and are always calm and patient. Stresses the need for owners of domestic pets to accept the responsibility of ownership.

results.title: Animal olympians
results.brief_description: Fascinating comparisons are made between human Olympic skills and feats in the animal world. Shows many animal performances such as breath-held depth diving, animal marksmen, gliding, speed flying, soaring and hovering.

results.title: Animal migration
results.brief_description: Describes the migratory patterns of animals such as the mountain sheep, monarch butterfly, whale, elephant seal, salmon and arctic tern. Examines the reasons for animals migrating, the ways in which they navigate, and the scientific methods used to study migration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal migration
results.brief_description: All over the earth animals undertake incredible journeys called migrations - over land, through air, and in the water. Animals migrate to find food, to escape seasonal changes in weather, and to breed. This video follows several species on their migratory paths, including gray whales, zooplankton, Mexican free-tailed bats and wildebeest. Whatever the reason, however long or short the journey, migration is one of the most fascinating animal behaviours. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s Guide included.

results.title: Animal Logic and Peter Rabbit
results.credit_line:
PETER RABBIT and all associated characters ™ & © Frederick Warne & Co Limited. PETER RABBIT™, the Movie ©2018 Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
PETER RABBIT and all associated characters ™ & © Frederick Warne & Co Limited. PETER RABBIT™ 2:The Runaway, the Movie ©2020 Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. All Rights Reserved.
Special thanks to Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Bringing the beloved characters of Beatrix Potter to life is no easy task, but Australian VFX studio Animal Logic did exactly that in Peter Rabbit and its sequel Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway.

constellations_other.name: Flipping through the evolution of animation
constellations_other.description: Animation has come a long way since flip books were popular. These optical toys gave the illusion of movement, but now whole films and special effects are animated entirely through computers.

results.description: Bringing the beloved characters of Beatrix Potter to life is no easy task, but Australian VFX studio Animal Logic did exactly that in Peter Rabbit and its sequel Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway. A hybrid of live-action and animation, the films deploy a range of techniques to bring Peter to life, along with the whole cast of characters including Flopsy, Mopsy and Cotton-Tail. From initial sketches based on Potter’s original artwork to digital and physical sculptures incorporating the physiology of real rabbits, the animation project was an intensive process from beginning to end.
description_for_label: Bringing the beloved characters of Beatrix Potter to life is no easy task, but Australian VFX studio Animal Logic did exactly that in Peter Rabbit and its sequel Peter Rabbit 2: The Runaway. A hybrid of live-action and animation, the films deploy a range of techniques to bring Peter to life, along with the whole cast of characters including Flopsy, Mopsy and Cotton-Tail. From initial sketches based on Potter’s original artwork to digital and physical sculptures incorporating the physiology of real rabbits, the animation project was an intensive process from beginning to end.

results.title: Animal life in the hedgerows
results.brief_description: A study of the English animals, birds, insects and other wild creatures to be found in the hedgerows and fiels, Photographed by Oliver Pike. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal life at low tide
results.creator_credit: Pat Dowling Pictures and Pat Dowling
results.brief_description: A boy and girl visit the seashore and, at a tide-pool find and study many salt-water animals and their means of locomotion, protection and getting food. Included are starfish, tube-building sea worms, sea anemone, limpet, sea urchin, snails and the moulting of hermit crabs. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Animal life
results.brief_description: A review of the main types of animal - protozoans, sponges, colelenterates, echinoderms, worms, molluscs, crustaceans, insects, and vertebrates. There is also a description of animal functions - locomotion, food intake, digestion, waste disposal, respiration, and nervous system activity.
